newsitem.title: USA: GPU shuts Oyster Creek, N.J. power station.
newsitem.headline: GPU shuts Oyster Creek, N.J. power station.

text.p: General Public Utilities Corp (GPU) shut its 610 megawatt (MW) Oyster Creek nuclear power station in Forked River, N.J., Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) reported Thursday.
The unit, currently in hot shutdown mode, automatically tripped off line "due to low main condensor vacuum," NRC said.
A GPU official confirmed the unit shut itself down Wednesday at at 2153 EDT.

"We were doing a backwash of the condensor system when we had a problem with the vacuum, which interrupted the flow of steam through the condensor," said Keith Bromery, manager of public information for GPU Nuclear, the station's operator.
Backwashing is routine maintenance that reverses the flow of steam and water through the condensor system to flush out marine life that would otherwise clog it.
He said Oyster Creek was scheduled to begin a 45-day maintenance outage September 7.
"It wouldn't make sense to try to restart the unit just two days away from a scheduled outage. So we're going to keep it down and try to move up as much work as possible," Bromery said.
